metadata.titel_preek: Seventh Sunday After the Epiphany: Romans 1:18–3 / Baptism of the Lord

kernfrasen: paying in his own body the price of sin
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SALVATION IS AN UNMERITED FINANCIAL GIFT

kernfrasen: transition from the manger to the cross

dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DIVINE GRACE IS AN INVASIVE FORCE

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: He puts redemption into our blanket.

cognitieve_implicaties: The recipient is unaware and passive during the act of giving.
theologische_implicaties: Grace is entirely monergistic; human effort is irrelevant to the initial gift.
ethische_implicaties: Gratitude is the only appropriate response to an unearned benefit.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests God is a 'passerby' rather than a constant presence; implies grace is a commodity (money).

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'gift' metaphor by using the gritty, contemporary imagery of the Port Authority terminal.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon balances the 'Terror of God' (Verticality/Force) with 'Grace as Gift' (Economic). It uses the 'Fear of the Lord' as a prerequisite schema for understanding the magnitude of the gift.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The angel sits 'patiently' like a guest, then acts as a 'consuming fire'.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A guest requires hospitality; a fire destroys the host's offerings.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Paradox: The preacher argues that the 'fire' of judgment is the same 'fire' that enables salvation.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses the Port Authority anecdote to make the abstract concept of 'Redemption' concrete and emotionally resonant.
sterktes.voorbeeld: He does not ask for a receipt; he puts redemption into our blanket.

risicos.beschrijving: Comparing grace to a dollar bill might reduce the ontological change of salvation to a mere financial transaction.
risicos.voorbeeld: passengers put a dollar bill or two... into her blanket
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view grace as a 'bonus' rather than a transformation.

sub_worlds: Peter's boat on the Sea of Galilee

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sense of shared human hopelessness across time.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Emphasis on 'terror' and 'holy dread' to counter modern 'God as buddy' schemas.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: The 'turning around' effort of the addict is contrasted with the 'unasked for' gift in the blanket.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with Epiphany (Manifestation) by focusing on the 'irruption' of the divine into the mundane.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the tension between the 'Vertical/Military' domain (God's terrifying power) and the 'Economic/Gift' domain (Grace as unmerited currency). It successfully moves from 'God as Judge/Fire' to 'God as Anonymous Benefactor'.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'addiction' source domain used in the Port Authority story to explain the 'bondage' of sin.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Sin is not just a mistake; it is a chemical dependency on our own ego.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Connect the 'patience' of the angel to the 'waiting' of the cross, showing that God's fire is directed at the sin, not the person.

entailment_checks.metafoor: GRACE IS MONEY IN A BLANKET
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Money is spent and gone; it doesn't change the person.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that the 'gift' is the presence of the Giver, not just a 'dollar' of merit.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To link Gideon's wheat and Peter's fish to the 'growth' of the Kingdom.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the gap between ancient text and contemporary urban experience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the Port Authority story, CMT reveals how it re-wires the hearer's understanding of passivity in salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'feeling' to the cognitive mapping of 'Terror' as a necessary spatial orientation for 'Wisdom'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Identifies that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (mercy from above) to resolve the 'Force' (terror) of the epiphany.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom
appendices.notities: The preacher effectively uses 'Schema Disruption' by starting with the 'funny' image of Gideon to lower defenses before introducing 'Holy Dread'.
